description: From Yiddish מבֿין‎ (meyvn, “expert, connoisseur, know-it-all”), from Hebrew מֵבִין‎ (mevín, “one who understands, connoisseur, expert”), from הֵבִין‎ (hevín, “to understand”).

entries.meaning: (chiefly US) An expert in a given field.
examples: Connectors know people—lots of people. Mavens know about things. They know, or find out first, what is going on. Connectors, says Gladwell, need mavens to tell them what to buzz about.
